summary_and_description:
URL encoding issue when saving web pages with spaces

Problem:
When saving complete web pages containing spaces in their paths:
1. Spaces are initially encoded as %20 (correct)
2. Upon loading the saved page, %20 becomes double-encoded as %2520 (incorrect)

Reproduction:
1. Save a page with spaces (e.g., 'http://example.com/space test.html')
2. Local save path converts spaces to %20
3. When reopening, embedded resources fail due to %2520 in paths

Example:
Original URL: http://www.mozilla.org/space test.html
Saved as: file:///c:/My%20Documents/space%20test.html
Resource paths incorrectly resolve to: space%2520test_files/image.jpg

Technical Analysis:
- First encoding pass: space → %20 (expected)
- Second encoding pass: % → %25 (unexpected double-encoding)
- Affects all local file:/// paths containing originally-spaced URLs

Impact:
Breaks offline viewing of saved pages containing spaces in their original paths
